ADV_1.name: Noble
ADV_1.rules: The hero receives respect, enjoys a noble’s privileges, and can gain bonuses from the GM when interacting with people of lower status. For more details, see **Core Rules** page **338**.
ADV_1.req: Culture with a class system that incorporates an aristocracy.

ADV_2.name: Resistant to Aging
ADV_2.rules: The hero is immune to natural and magical aging, and does not suffer the negative effects of old age.

ADV_3.name: Pleasant Smelling
ADV_3.rules: Skill checks with *Seduction (Flirting, Romantic Arts)* receive a bonus of 1.

ADV_4.name: Aptitude
ADV_4.rules: A character with the Aptitude advantage can reroll a single D20 in every skill check for the chosen skill. The player rolls 3D20 as usual but picks one die result to reroll, keeping the best result. Aptitudes must be purchased individually for each skill, spell, or liturgical chant. You cannot purchase Aptitude for the same skill more than once (because you cannot use Aptitude to reroll more than one D20 in a check). You cannot invoke this advantage if the skill check results in a double 20 or a triple 20. You cannot pick an Aptitude for a *combat technique* (for this, you must use the advantage Weapon Aptitude, on **Core Rules** page **170**). You can choose to spend a FtP before or after invoking your Aptitude (see page 28), meaning it’s possible to reroll more than once or even combine another FtP effect with an Aptitude.
ADV_4.req: ~~disadvantage Incompetent with the skill~~, no more than three Aptitudes per character

ADV_5.name: Ambidextrous
ADV_5.rules: Heroes with this advantage suffer no penalties to skill checks for using their off hands. In combat, they do not suffer penalties for wielding weapons in their off hands (see **Core Rules** page **238**).

ADV_6.name: Darksight
ADV_6.rules: At level I of this advantage, reduce darkness penalties by one level. Level II allows you to ignore all darkness penalties. In complete darkness, Darksight (level I or II) doesn’t work at all and the full penalties for complete darkness apply (see **Core Rules** page **348**).

ADV_7.name: Iron-Attuned Aura
ADV_7.rules: With this advantage, you suffer a penalty for every 4 full pounds of weight due to the Iron Ban, not every 2 full pounds, as usual (see **Core Rules** page **250**).

ADV_8.name: Sense of Range
ADV_8.rules: Checks for ranged combat with projectile weapons suffer a penalty of 1 instead of 2 for targets in the range bracket Far. This penalty applies only to projectile weapons, not thrown weapons.
ADV_8.range: 200 yards. Beyond that distance, your assessment gets less and less accurate.

ADV_10.name: Fox Sense
ADV_10.rules: The hero can perceive traps that cannot be found with ordinary senses. With this advantage, the hero can use *Fox Sense* as an application for the skill *Perception*.

ADV_11.name: Natural Orator
ADV_11.rules: Skill checks using *Persuasion (Oration)* receive a bonus of 1.

ADV_12.name: Blessed
ADV_12.rules: The hero receives a karma base stat of 20 karma points (KP). Each Blessed One must also begin the game with a *Tradition* (a special ability—see **Core Rules** page **316**), which you must buy separately. Also, you can be consecrated to only one deity at a time— it is not possible to buy another Tradition. A hero who desires to become a Blessed One may acquire this advantage later in life.

ADV_13.name: Resistant to Poison
ADV_13.rules: Resistant to Poison raises your Toughness and Spirit by 1 per level when resisting poison.

ADV_14.name: Luck
ADV_14.rules: Your maximum number of FtP (as determined by Experience Level) increases by 1 per level of this advantage. Add any additional FtP to the hero’s total.

ADV_15.name: Good Looks
ADV_15.rules: The hero receives a bonus of 1 per level of this advantage for checks using *Commerce (Haggling)*, *Fast-Talk (Hard Sell, Manipulate, Subterfuge, Sweet-Talk)*, and *Seduction (Flirting, Romantic Arts)*.

ADV_16.name: Exceptional Skill
ADV_16.rules: The advantage Exceptional Skill raises the maximum skill rating in the skill by 1. This includes both the maximum at character creation and the final maximum stat (which depends on the highest attribute involved; see **Core Rules** page **39**). The hero doesn’t receive a free skill point, but can start the game with an SR of 11 (instead of 10) when using an Experience Level of *Experienced*. The final maximum also rises by 1 point. You can purchase this advantage four times, but no more than twice for the same skill. If you take the advantage twice for a certain skill, the maximum SR rises by 2.
ADV_16.apValue: A/B/C/D skill: 2/4/6/8 adventure points per raise

ADV_17.name: Exceptional Combat Technique
ADV_17.rules: The advantage Exceptional Combat Technique raises the maximum stat in the combat technique by 1. This means both the maximum for character creation and the final maximum stat (depending on the highest attribute involved, see **Core Rules** page **39**). The hero doesn’t receive a point in the technique, but can start the game with a stat of 13 (instead of 12) when using an experience level of *Experienced*. The hero’s final maximum also rises by 1 point. You can purchase this advantage twice, but only once for a particular combat technique.

ADV_18.name: Exceptional Sense (Sight)
ADV_18.rules: A character with Exceptional Sense receives a bonus of 1 for checks with *Perception*, but only if the check uses the named sense. You can choose from the following senses: Sight, Hearing, Smell & Taste, Tactile Sense. You can purchase Exceptional Sense more than once (for different senses), but only once per sense.
ADV_18.req: ~~disadvantage Restricted Sense for the same sense~~, ~~disadvantage Blind~~ (for Sight), ~~disadvantage Deaf~~ (for Hearing)

ADV_22.name: Resistant to Heat
ADV_22.rules: Reduce the hero’s Heat Level by 1, to a minimum of 1 (see **Core Rules** page **347**).

ADV_23.name: Increased Astral Power
ADV_23.rules: Raise your AE base stat by 1 point per level of the advantage.

ADV_24.name: Increased Karma Points
ADV_24.rules: Raise your KP base stat by 1 point per level of the advantage.

ADV_25.name: Increased Life Points
ADV_25.rules: Raise your LP base stat by 1 point per level of the advantage.

ADV_26.name: Increased Spirit
ADV_26.rules: Improve the hero’s Spirit base stat by 1.

ADV_27.name: Increased Toughness
ADV_27.rules: Improve the hero’s Toughness base stat by 1.

ADV_28.name: Immunity to (Poison)
ADV_28.rules: You are immune to a certain type of poison, which has no effect on you at all. Immunity to (Poison) must be purchased for each poison separately.
ADV_28.apValue: Half the chosen poison’s level in adventure points

ADV_29.name: Immunity to (Disease)
ADV_29.rules: If you are immune to a certain type of disease, you never catch it. Immunity to (Disease) must be purchased for each disease separately.
ADV_29.apValue: Half the chosen disease’s level in adventure points

ADV_30.name: Resistant to Cold
ADV_30.rules: Reduce the hero’s Cold Level by 1, to a minimum of 0 (see **Core Rules** page **346**).

ADV_31.name: Resistant to Disease
ADV_31.rules: Resistant to Disease raises your Toughness and Spirit by 1 per level for resisting diseases.

ADV_32.name: Magical Attunement
ADV_32.rules: You must choose an environment for this advantage (see below for examples). The spellcaster receives a bonus of 1 with magical skill checks in the chosen environment or situation.
ADV_32.reqEnd: ~~disadvantage Magical Restriction for the same environment~~

ADV_33.name: Mystic
ADV_33.rules: For a mystic, the condition *Rapture* decreases by 1 level every two hours instead of every hour.

ADV_34.name: Needs no Sleep
ADV_34.rules: Characters with this advantage don’t need to sleep regularly and can stay awake for a week without getting tired. However, they must make up for the lost sleep later. Some races need actual sleep to recover, while others need only meditation or a similar technique. A hero with this advantage who goes without sleep cannot benefit from regular sleep and rest during Regeneration Phases (but can benefit from healing herbs and the skill *Treat Wounds*).

ADV_35.name: Pragmatic
ADV_35.rules: For a pragmatic, *Rapture* drops by 1 level per halfhour instead of every hour.

ADV_36.name: Rich
ADV_36.rules: The hero receives 250 additional silverthalers per level during character creation.

ADV_37.name: Direction Sense
ADV_37.rules: Skill checks using *Orienting* receive a bonus of 1.

ADV_38.name: Contortionist
ADV_38.rules: Checks using *Body Control (Acrobatics, Squirm)* receive a bonus of 1.

ADV_39.name: Difficult to Enchant
ADV_39.rules: Most spells cast on the hero suffer a penalty of 1. This includes all spells and magical effects with the properties *Clairvoyance*, *Healing*, *Influence*, and *Transformation*, as well as spells modified by *Spirit* or *Toughness*. The penalty applies even if the hero wants the magic to take effect.

ADV_40.name: Socially Adaptable
ADV_40.rules: Heroes with Socially Adaptable can ignore penalties to social skills that result from class distinctions (see **Core Rules** page **338**). The advantage Socially Adaptable doesn’t fool people of high noble breeding.

ADV_41.name: Unremarkable Appearance
ADV_41.rules: Heroes with this advantage receive a bonus of 1 with *Streetwise (Shadowing)*.

ADV_42.name: Improved Regeneration (Arcane Energy)
ADV_42.rules: During regeneration, the hero receives 1 additional point of AE for each level of the advantage.

ADV_43.name: Improved Regeneration (Karma Points)
ADV_43.rules: During regeneration, the hero receives 1 additional KP for each level of the advantage.

ADV_44.name: Improved Regeneration (Life Points)
ADV_44.rules: During regeneration, the hero receives 1 additional LP during regeneration for each level of the advantage.

ADV_45.name: Hidden Aura
ADV_45.rules: The spellcaster always appears non-magical to undirected magical perception. Anybody trying to find or analyze the spellcaster (by using the spell *Odem Arcanum* or the liturgical chant *See Magic*, for example) suffers a penalty of 3.

ADV_46.name: Inspire Confidence
ADV_46.rules: Checks with *Commerce (Haggling)*, *Fast-Talk (Begging, Manipulate, Sweet-Talk)*, or *Persuasion (Conversation, Debate, Oration)* receive a bonus of 1.

ADV_47.name: Weapon Aptitude
ADV_47.rules: When making a roll with a combat technique, a Weapon Aptitude allows one reroll of a confirmation roll for critical hits and botches.

ADV_48.name: Beautiful Voice
ADV_48.rules: Skill checks using *Singing* receive a bonus of 1.

ADV_49.name: Rugged Fighter
ADV_49.rules: Ignore the effects of the highest level of the condition *Pain* you possess, and suffer the effect of the next lower level instead. So, a hero with three levels of *Pain* only suffers the effect of Level II. *Pain* of Level IV still incapacitates you. Treat *Pain* Level I as if you don’t have any levels of *Pain*.

ADV_50.name: Spellcaster
ADV_50.rules: The spellcaster receives an arcane energy base stat of 20 AE. This advantage doesn’t include the special ability *Tradition* (see **Core Rules** page **274**), which you must purchase separately. All Spellcasters must start the game with a Tradition. You cannot purchase this advantage later in the game.

ADV_51.name: Inner Clock
ADV_51.rules: The character has a perfect sense of time and can determine the exact time of day without seeing the sun or using other tools.

ADV_52.name: Two-Voiced Singing
ADV_52.rules: A hero can use Two-Voiced Singing and can learn magical elven songs. The hero can use the application *Two-Voiced Singing* for the skill *Singing*.

ADV_53.name: Dwarf's Nose
ADV_53.rules: The hero receives a bonus of 1 for *Perception* checks when trying to find secret doors, cavities, hidden drawers, or the like.

DISADV_1.name: Afraid of...
DISADV_1.rules: The hero suffers a level of *Fear* (see **Core Rules** page **32**) for each level of this disadvantage whenever confronted with the trigger.

DISADV_2.name: Poor
DISADV_2.rules: For each level of this disadvantage, the hero receives 250 silverthalers less starting wealth during character creation. If you take 3 levels of Poor, you receive no starting wealth and begin the game with only a clothes package from the category Not Free (see **Core Rules** page **375**).

DISADV_3.name: Bound to Artifact
DISADV_3.rules: A spellcaster who doesn’t have direct skin contact with the artifact suffers a penalty of 1 to magic checks when casting spells. If the artifact is destroyed, the spellcaster has trouble casting spells and must create another artifact in order to remove the penalty.

DISADV_4.name: Slow
DISADV_4.rules: This disadvantage reduces your hero’s Movement by 1.

DISADV_5.name: Blind
DISADV_5.rules: This disadvantage makes many skills difficult or impossible. The same goes for special abilities. The GM decides which penalties to apply to which checks. This kind of blindness can only be healed by a *Great Miracle* (see **Core Rules** page **315**). While so afflicted, the hero has the state of *blind* (see **Core Rules** page **34**).

DISADV_6.name: Frenzy
DISADV_6.rules: The hero receives the state of *bloodlust* in special circumstances. Frenzy activates when the hero receives a level of *Pain* from an attack or fails a *Willpower* check to resist the negative trait Short Temper.

DISADV_7.name: Restricted Sense (Sight)
DISADV_7.rules: A character with a Restricted Sense suffers a penalty of 2 for checks with Perception, but only if the check relies upon the stated sense. Restricted Sight imposes a penalty of 2 for ranged combat. You can choose the following senses: Sight, Hearing, Smell & Taste, Tactile Sense. A hero can have at most two Restricted Senses.

DISADV_10.name: Restricted Sense (Tactile Sense)
DISADV_10.rules: A character with a Restricted Sense suffers a penalty of 2 for checks with Perception, but only if the check relies upon the stated sense. Restricted Sight imposes a penalty of 2 for ranged combat. You can choose the following senses: Sight, Hearing, Smell & Taste, Tactile Sense. A hero can have at most two Restricted Senses.
DISADV_10.req: ~~disadvantage Exceptional Sense for the same sense~~, ~~disadvantage Blind~~ (for Sight), ~~disadvantage Deaf~~ (for Hearing)

DISADV_11.name: Color-Blind
DISADV_11.rules: The adventurer cannot distinguish between colors. This can have negative effects on some checks, like *Alchemy* (“pour two drops of red liquid into the green liquid”), recognizing coats of arms (*Etiquette*), or *Orienting* in the jungle. The GM decides the magnitude of the penalty and also whether a check is even possible.

DISADV_12.name: Fat
DISADV_12.rules: This disadvantage gives a penalty of 1 to *Body Control*, *Climbing*, *Dancing*, and *Stealth*.

DISADV_13.name: Susceptible to Poison
DISADV_13.rules: Susceptible to Poison lowers your Toughness and Spirit by 1 per level when resisting poison.

DISADV_14.name: Ugly
DISADV_14.rules: The hero suffer a penalty of 1 per level of this advantage for checks using *Commerce (Haggling)*, *Fast-Talk (Manipulate, Sweet-Talk)*, and *Seduction (Flirting, Romantic Arts)*.

DISADV_15.name: Susceptible to Heat
DISADV_15.rules: When subjected to hot conditions of Level 2 or greater (see **Core Rules** page **347**), the hero suffers an additional level of Heat.

DISADV_16.name: Susceptible to Cold
DISADV_16.rules: Whenever subjected to cold conditions (minimum of Cold Level 1—see **Core Rules** page **346**), the hero suffers an additional level of Cold.

DISADV_17.name: No Flying Balm
DISADV_17.rules: The hero cannot possess the special ability *Flying Balm*. This makes the special ability *Tradition (Witch)* 10 points cheaper.

reqIndex.2: Magical Tradition that can choose the special ability Flying Balm

DISADV_18.name: No Familiar
DISADV_18.rules: The hero cannot have the special ability *Connection to Familiar*. This makes the special ability *Tradition (Witch)* 10 points cheaper.

reqIndex.2: Magical Tradition that can choose the special ability Connection to Familiar

DISADV_19.name: Hair-Bound Power
DISADV_19.rules: A hero who loses some hair for any reason (by cutting, fire, and so on; length doesn’t matter), also loses 10 points of AE immediately (minimum 0). AE lost in this manner regenerates the usual way. Hairlost due to everyday shedding doesn’t activate this disadvantage.
DISADV_19.reqEnd: Spezies des Zauberers muss über Haare verfügen

DISADV_20.name: Physical Peculiarity
DISADV_20.rules: You can choose Physical Peculiarities no more than twice. Physical peculiarities sometimes lead to penalties for social skills due to superstition or distrust.

DISADV_21.name: Susceptible to Disease
DISADV_21.rules: Susceptible to Disease lowers your Toughness and Spirit by 1 per level when resisting diseases.

DISADV_22.name: Annoyed by Minor Spirits
DISADV_22.rules: Each time the spellcaster spends AE, the player rolls 1D20. If the result is lower than or equal to the amount of AE spent, minor spirits appear and harass the spellcaster. The GM decides what kind of minor spirits appear, depending on the situation. Examples include *windbags*, which make the spellcaster’s hair blow around, *tearlings* that sit under the eyes, and *firescuttles*, which can heat or burn the spellcaster’s possessions. All skill checks suffer a penalty of 1 due to the minor spirit’s distraction. Even if you attract more than one type of minor spirit at the same time, the penalty does not increase. Minor spirits stay around for 10 minutes and then disappear.

DISADV_23.name: Sensitive to Sunlight
DISADV_23.rules: The hero suffers a level of the condition *Pain* when in sunlight brighter than twilight, but can avoid the effect by covering up from head to toe (including the eyes).

DISADV_24.name: Magical Restriction
DISADV_24.rules: Spellcasters suffer no penalties to magic skill checks while in the stated environment, but suffer a penalty of 1 in all other environments.

DISADV_25.name: Night-Blind
DISADV_25.rules: Whenever the hero suffers at least one Level of Visibility penalties due to darkness, the penalty counts as one Level higher (see **Core Rules** page **348**).

DISADV_26.name: Decreased Arcane Power
DISADV_26.rules: Reduce your AE base stat by 1 point per level of this disadvantage.

DISADV_27.name: Decreased Karma Points
DISADV_27.rules: Reduce your KP base stat by 1 point per level of this disadvantage.

DISADV_28.name: Decreased Life Points
DISADV_28.rules: Reduce your LP base stat by 1 point per level of this disadvantage.

DISADV_29.name: Decreased Spirit
DISADV_29.rules: Reduce the hero’s Spirit base stat by 1.

DISADV_30.name: Decreased Toughness
DISADV_30.rules: Reduce the hero’s Toughness base stat by 1.

DISADV_31.name: Bad Luck
DISADV_31.rules: The hero starts the game with one less FtP per level of this disadvantage. The hero’s maximum number of FtP drops, too, by one point per level of this disadvantage. The hero’s total number of FtP cannot be reduced below 0.

DISADV_32.name: Misfortune
DISADV_32.rules: If the GM must decide something randomly (Which hero does the arrow hit? Who was near the trap when it was activated?), the chances of something bad happening are twice as high for an adventurer with this disadvantage than for others. If several heroes in a group were to choose this disadvantage, they would cancel out each other’s disadvantages, so talk to your GM about choosing Misfortune.

DISADV_33.name: Personality Flaw
DISADV_33.rules: The GM can penalize relevant skill checks by 1 in applicable situations. You can choose at most two personality flaws per hero (the exception is Unworldly— see below).

DISADV_34.name: Principles
DISADV_34.rules: Principles has three levels. The first level restricts the hero only slightly, the second level is demanding, and the third places heavy restrictions on the hero’s actions. The hero can follow more than one set of principles, but can receive adventure points for this disadvantage only once (for the highest level of Principles). Characters acting against their principles suffer a penalty of 1 in all skill checks for at least an hour (the GM determines duration based on the situation).

DISADV_35.name: Sleepwalker
DISADV_35.rules: The hero won’t sleepwalk more than once per week. During the full 24-hour day after sleepwalking, the hero suffers one level of the condition *Stupor* from lack of rest. Reduce regeneration by 1 for the night spent sleepwalking.

DISADV_36.name: Bad Habit
DISADV_36.rules: Characters can choose as many Bad Habits as they wish, but can receive 6 AP at most. In rare cases, bad habits might lead to penalties for social skills.

DISADV_37.name: Negative Trait
DISADV_37.rules: When confronting possible triggers, characters must succeed at a *Willpower* check or else act out their Negative Trait, which controls them as long as they remain in the trigger’s presence. GM-assigned bonuses and penalties for *Willpower* checks depend on the trigger’s severity. You can choose up to two Negative Traits per character. You can’t take a combination that doesn’t make sense (combining Stinginess with Wastefulness, for example). The GM has the final say.

DISADV_38.name: Weak Regeneration (Arcane Energy)
DISADV_38.rules: The hero subtracts 1 from each regeneration roll for each level of this disadvantage (minimum 0).

DISADV_39.name: Weak Regeneration (Karma Points)
DISADV_39.rules: The hero subtracts 1 per level of this disadvantage from each regeneration roll (minimum 0).

DISADV_40.name: Weak Regeneration (Life Points)
DISADV_40.rules: The hero subtracts 1 per level of this disadvantage from each regeneration roll (minimum 0).

DISADV_41.name: Weak Astral Body
DISADV_41.rules: The hero loses one additional AE whenever required to spend AE.

DISADV_42.name: Weak Karmic Body
DISADV_42.rules: The hero loses one additional KP whenever required to spend KP.

DISADV_43.name: Sensitive Nose
DISADV_43.rules: The hero suffers one level of the condition *Stupor* as long as the smell persists.

DISADV_44.name: Speech Impediment
DISADV_44.rules: At the GM’s discretion, the hero can suffer a penalty of 1 on all social skills (except *Empathy* and *Willpower*) as well as *Commerce (Haggling)* when speaking to other people. You can take this disadvantage only once.

DISADV_45.name: Stigma
DISADV_45.rules: In an appropriate situation, the GM can penalize social skills (except *Empathy*, *Intimidation*, and *Willpower*) and *Commerce (Haggling)* by 1. You can take this disadvantage only once.

DISADV_46.name: Mute
DISADV_46.rules: The hero has trouble communicating vocally with other people (but could use sign language or writing). Spells and other actions requiring language are impossible or very difficult to use. The hero gains the state of *mute*.

DISADV_47.name: Deaf
DISADV_47.rules: The hero cannot make *Perception* checks based on hearing, and receives the state of *deaf*.

DISADV_48.name: Incompetent
DISADV_48.rules: When making skill checks for the named skill, the hero must reroll the best die and keep the second result. An adventurer cannot be Incompetent with more than two skills.
DISADV_48.req: ~~advantage Aptitude for the same skill~~, at most two disadvantages Incompetent

DISADV_49.name: Not Free
DISADV_49.rules: Characters with the disadvantage Not Free suffer penalties when using social skills to influence people of a higher social rank. They must deal with culturesanctioned oppression, may have few legal protections, and are almost always treated as someone else’s property. See **Core Rules** page **338** for more details.

DISADV_50.name: Obligations
DISADV_50.rules: The hero must obey the entity’s commands or suffer the consequences. Heroes can be obliged to more than one institution or group, but can receive adventure points for this disadvantage only once (for the highest level of Obligations).

a Blessed One to a Church
